mn141:2.2.pli: catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ ācikkhanā desanā paññāpanā paṭṭhapanā vivaraṇā vibhajanā uttānīkammaṁ.
mn141:2.2.en: It is the teaching, advocating, establishing, clarifying, analyzing, and revealing of the four noble truths.

mn141:4.2.pli: imesaṁ catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ ācikkhanā desanā paññāpanā paṭṭhapanā vivaraṇā vibhajanā uttānīkammaṁ.
mn141:4.2.en: It is the teaching, advocating, establishing, clarifying, analyzing, and revealing of the four noble truths.

mn141:5.7.pli: Sāriputto, bhikkhave, pahoti cattāri ariyasaccāni vitthārena ācikkhituṁ desetuṁ paññāpetuṁ paṭṭhapetuṁ vivarituṁ vibhajituṁ uttānīkātun”ti.
mn141:5.7.en: Sāriputta is able to teach, assert, establish, clarify, analyze, and reveal the four noble truths.”

mn141:8.2.pli: catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ ācikkhanā desanā paññāpanā paṭṭhapanā vivaraṇā vibhajanā uttānīkammaṁ.
mn141:8.2.en: It is the teaching, advocating, establishing, clarifying, analyzing, and revealing of the four noble truths.

mn141:32.2.pli: imesaṁ catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ ācikkhanā desanā paññāpanā paṭṭhapanā vivaraṇā vibhajanā uttānīkamman”ti.
mn141:32.2.en: It is the teaching, advocating, establishing, clarifying, analyzing, and revealing of the four noble truths.”

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 141
The Analysis of the Truths

sn56.15:1.1.pli: “Dhāretha no tumhe, bhikkhave, mayā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānī”ti?
sn56.15:1.1.en: “Mendicants, do you remember the four noble truths that I taught?”

sn56.15:1.9.pli: Evaṁ khvāhaṁ, bhante, dhāremi bhagavatā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānī”ti.
sn56.15:1.9.en: That’s how I remember the four noble truths as you’ve taught them.”

sn56.15:2.2.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṁ, bhikkhu, dhāresi mayā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānīti.
sn56.15:2.2.en: It’s good that you remember the four noble truths as I’ve taught them.

sn56.15:2.7.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhu, dhārehi mayā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānīti.
sn56.15:2.7.en: That’s how you should remember the four noble truths as I’ve taught them.

sn56.16:1.1.en: “Mendicants, do you remember the four noble truths that I taught?”

sn56.16:3.2.en: It’s good that you remember the four noble truths as I’ve taught them.

sn56.16:3.15.pli: Evaṁ kho tvaṁ, bhikkhu, dhārehi mayā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānīti.
sn56.16:3.15.en: That’s how you should remember the four noble truths as I’ve taught them.

sn56.23:1.2.en: “Mendicants, there are these four noble truths.

sn56.23:1.5.en: These are the four noble truths.

sn56.23:1.6.pli: Imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ yathābhūtaṁ abhisambuddhattā tathāgato ‘arahaṁ sammāsambuddho’ti vuccati.
sn56.23:1.6.en: It is because he has truly woken up to these four noble truths that the Realized One is called ‘the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha’.

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 56
3. At the Village of Koṭi
23. The Fully Awakened Buddha

sn56.29:1.1.en: “Mendicants, there are these four noble truths.

sn56.29:1.4.en: These are the four noble truths.

sn56.29:1.5.pli: Imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ atthi ariyasaccaṁ pariññeyyaṁ, atthi ariyasaccaṁ pahātabbaṁ, atthi ariyasaccaṁ sacchikātabbaṁ, atthi ariyasaccaṁ bhāvetabbaṁ.
sn56.29:1.5.en: Of these four noble truths, there is one to be completely understood, one to be given up, one to be realized, and one to be developed.

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 56
3. At the Village of Koṭi
29. Should Be Completely Understood

sn56.35:1.4.pli: So kho tvaṁ, ambho purisa, divase divase tīhi tīhi sattisatehi haññamāno vassasatāyuko vassasatajīvī vassasatassa accayena anabhisametāni cattāri ariyasaccāni abhisamessasī’ti.
sn56.35:1.4.en: And you’ll live for a hundred years being struck with three hundred spears every day. But when a hundred years have passed, you will comprehend the four noble truths for the first time.’

sn56.35:2.6.pli: Na kho panāhaṁ, bhikkhave, saha dukkhena, saha domanassena catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ abhisamayaṁ vadāmi;
sn56.35:2.6.en: But the comprehension of the four noble truths doesn’t come with pain or sadness, I say.

sn56.35:2.7.pli: api cāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sahāva sukhena, sahāva somanassena catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ abhisamayaṁ vadāmi.
sn56.35:2.7.en: Rather, the comprehension of the four noble truths comes only with pleasure and happiness, I say.

an3.61:9.6.pli: Imāni cattāri ariyasaccānīti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi.
an3.61:9.6.en: ‘These are the four noble truths’: this is the Dhamma I’ve taught that is irrefutable, uncorrupted, beyond reproach, and is not scorned by sensible ascetics and brahmins.

an3.61:13.1.pli: Imāni cattāri ariyasaccānīti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhīti.
an3.61:13.1.en: ‘“These are the four noble truths”: this is the Dhamma I’ve taught …’

an3.61:17.5.pli: ‘Imāni cattāri ariyasaccānī’ti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhīti.
an3.61:17.5.en: ‘“These are the four noble truths”: this is the Dhamma I’ve taught that is irrefutable, uncorrupted, beyond reproach, and is not scorned by sensible ascetics and brahmins.’

mn10:44.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati catūsu ariyasaccesu.
mn10:44.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of principles with respect to the four noble truths.

mn10:44.2.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati catūsu ariyasaccesu?
mn10:44.2.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the four noble truths?

mn10:45.4.pli: Evampi kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati catūsu ariyasaccesu.
mn10:45.4.en: That’s how a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of principles with respect to the four noble truths.

sn56.26:1.1.pli: “Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, anukampeyyātha, ye ca sotabbaṁ maññeyyuṁ—mittā vā amaccā vā ñātī vā sālohitā vā—te vo, bhikkhave, catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ yathābhūtaṁ abhisamayāya samādapetabbā nivesetabbā patiṭṭhāpetabbā.
sn56.26:1.1.en: “Mendicants, those who you have sympathy for, and those worth listening to—friends and colleagues, relatives and family—should be encouraged, supported, and established in the true comprehension of the four noble truths.

sn56.26:2.3.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, anukampeyyātha, ye ca sotabbaṁ maññeyyuṁ—mittā vā amaccā vā ñātī vā sālohitā vā—te vo, bhikkhave, imesaṁ catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ yathābhūtaṁ abhisamayāya samādapetabbā nivesetabbā patiṭṭhāpetabbā.
sn56.26:2.3.en: Those who you have sympathy for, and those worth listening to—friends and colleagues, relatives and family—should be encouraged, supported, and established in the true comprehension of these four noble truths.

sn56.3:1.3.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, etarahi kulaputtā sammā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti, sabbe te catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ yathābhūtaṁ abhisamayāya.
sn56.3:1.3.en: or present—rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness, all of them do so in order to truly comprehend the four noble truths.

sn56.3:2.5.pli: pabbajanti, sabbe te imesaṁyeva catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ yathābhūtaṁ abhisamayāya.
sn56.3:2.5.en: or present—rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness, all of them do so in order to truly comprehend the four noble truths.

sn56.38:2.6.pli: Neva tāva catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ ācikkhaṇā hoti desanā paññāpanā paṭṭhapanā vivaraṇā vibhajanā uttānīkammaṁ.
sn56.38:2.6.en: There’s no explanation of the four noble truths, no teaching, advocating, establishing, clarifying, analyzing, and revealing of them.

sn56.38:3.3.pli: Atha kho catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ ācikkhaṇā hoti desanā paññāpanā paṭṭhapanā vivaraṇā vibhajanā uttānīkammaṁ.
sn56.38:3.3.en: Then there’s the explanation of the four noble truths, the teaching, advocating, establishing, clarifying, analyzing, and revealing of them.

sn56.11:9.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca me, bhikkhave, imesu catūsu ariyasaccesu evaṁ tiparivaṭṭaṁ dvādasākāraṁ yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇadassanaṁ na suvisuddhaṁ ahosi, neva tāvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya ‘anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddho’ti paccaññāsiṁ.
sn56.11:9.1.en: As long as my true knowledge and vision about these four noble truths was not fully purified in these three perspectives and twelve respects, I didn’t announce my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.

sn56.11:10.1.pli: Yato ca kho me, bhikkhave, imesu catūsu ariyasaccesu evaṁ tiparivaṭṭaṁ dvādasākāraṁ yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇadassanaṁ suvisuddhaṁ ahosi, athāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya ‘anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddho’ti paccaññāsiṁ.
sn56.11:10.1.en: But when my true knowledge and vision about these four noble truths was fully purified in these three perspectives and twelve respects, I announced my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
